elements.name: furo-api-fetch
elements.description:
Use `furo-api-fetch` to fetch data from the network.


```html
<furo-api-fetch fn-invoke-request="--Request"></furo-api-fetch>
```

properties.name: lastRequest
properties.description:
LastRequest's response.

Note that lastResponse is set when ongoing request finishes, so if loading is true,
then lastResponse will correspond to the result of the previous request.

properties.name: isLoading
properties.description: True while request is in flight.

methods.name: invoke-request
methods.description: Sends a HTTP request to the server

methods.name: abort-request
methods.description:
Aborts a pending request
You have to submit an AbortController

events.name: fatal-error
events.description: Requests are made via the Fetch API if possible.Fallback XMLHttpRequest

events.name: request-started
events.description: Fired when a request is sent.

events.name: request-aborted
events.description: Fired when a request was canceled.

events.name: response-raw
events.description: Fired when a response is received.

events.name: response
events.description: Fired when a response is received. Here you will get the parsed response Format depends on request header `content-type` supported types: - text/plain - application/json - image/jpeg (Blob) - application/octet-stream (ArrayBuffer) - application/pdf (Blob)

events.name: response-error-raw
events.description: Fired when a error has occoured.

events.name: response-error
events.description: Fired when an error has occoured. This is a general error event. The specific error events are fired additionally.

events.name: response-error-[status-code]
events.description: Fired when an error has occoured. This is a specific error event.

events.name: response-error-4xx
events.description: Fired when an error has occoured. This is a group error event. E.g. response-error-5xx, response-error-4xx

events.name: response-error-5xx
events.description: Fired when an error has occoured. This is a group error event. E.g. response-error-5xx, response-error-4xx

elements.name: furo-collection-agent

attributes.name: view
attributes.description:
Parameter for contextual representations

To reduce network traffic, it is sometimes useful to allow the client to limit which parts of the resource the server should return in its responses,
returning a view of the resource (i.e. specialized version for dropdowns ) instead of the full resource representation.

https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/design_patterns#resource_view

view=smallcards

Only useable if your service has implemented this feature.

attributes.name: filter
attributes.description:
Set the filter.

Hint: use the FieldNode._base64 property to send complex objects as a filter and decode it on the server side.

Only useable if your service has implemented this feature.

attributes.name: service
attributes.description: The service name from the specs.

attributes.name: page-size
attributes.description:
Sets pagination size in the List request.

Only useful if your service supports pagination.

attributes.name: fields
attributes.description:
Comma separated list of fields (like a fieldmask)
used for partial representation / partial responses.

If your services supports this feature, you will receive a subset of the fields.

attributes.name: order-by
attributes.description:
Sorting order

order-by="foo,-bar"  means foo asc and bar desc

https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/design_patterns#sorting_order

To avoid sql injection errors we do not send any sql like syntax!

Only useable if your service has implemented this feature.

attributes.name: list-on-hts-in
attributes.description: Executes a list when a rel="list" is injected.

attributes.name: load-rel-on-hts-in
attributes.description:
Executes a loadRel when a rel="XXXX" is injected.

You have to set the attributes *rel* and *method* to have this working.

This is useful for getting "custom" collections.

attributes.name: rel
attributes.description: rel which should be used on load rel

attributes.name: method
attributes.description:
for compatibility reasons you have to specify the method inside of the service.

This attribute should not be needed in future versions, because the rel already contains all relevant information.

methods.name: update-qp
methods.description:
Update query params
a qp like { active :true} will just update the qp *active*

If the current value of the qp is not the same like the injected value, a qp-changed event will be fired

methods.name: set-qp
methods.description:
Set query params
All existing query params are replaced by the transferred parameters
If the transferred object is empty, all the values will be removed!
The AgentHelper fires a qp-set event after the query params are replaced.

methods.description: clear the query params that you have setted before

methods.description: loads the entity if hts is available

methods.description: loads the entity following the link which is specified on the attribute **rel** if it is available.

methods.name: search-rel
methods.description:
search for a term following the link which is specified on the attribute **rel**

This will set the query param q and execute the query.

methods.name: search

search for a term.

This will set the query param q and triggers a list()

methods.description: loads the entity if hts is available

elements.name: furo-data-flow-repeat
elements.description:
`furo-data-flow-repeat` Is a bindable repeater.


 ```html
 <furo-data-flow-repeat identity-path="id" fn-bind-data="--data(*.repeaterfield)">
   <template>
     <furo-ui5-data-text-input-labeled
         fn-bind-data="--init"></furo-ui5-data-text-input-labeled>
   </template>
 </furo-data-flow-repeat>
 ```
 *The wire `--init` is fired from furo-data-flow-repeat*

 If you want to delete a repeated item, implement something which triggers the `deleteNode` method on the fieldNode itself.

 ## Available wires in the template:

-  `--init` : contains the repeated item, fired only once on creation of the repeated node
-  `--item` : contains the repeated item, fired on every inject
-  `--firstItem` : contains the repeated item, fired on the first element.
-  `--lastItem` : contains the repeated item, fired on the last element.
-  `--index` : contains a number with the index of the element.
-  `--host` : contains a reference to the host component.
-  `--trigger` : contains what was passed in to the triggering method.
-  `--triggerFirst` : contains what was passed in to the triggering method.
-  `--triggerLast` : contains what was passed in to the triggering method.
-  `--itemSelected` : contains nothing, is triggered with select(index).
-  `--itemDeSelected` : contains nothing, is triggered when another item is selected with select(index).

## Available attributes
**index** contains the current index of the item. Use this to fire a event with an index like `at-click="^^item-clicked(index)"`
**item** contains the current index of the item. Use this to fire a event with the repeated item like `at-click="^^item-selected(item)"`

properties.name: selectAddedItem
properties.description:
Enable this to select the created item. This will trigger a wire `--itemSelected` which can be wired to
`fn-focus="--itemSelected"`.

properties.name: identityPath
properties.description:
By setting this param, the repeater has not to rebuild the list on new data. It only updates the parts that have changed.

The path is a field, relative to the root of the repeated item.

methods.name: bind-data
methods.description:
Bind a repeater node.

If `identity-path` is not set, the list will be cleared every time it receives new data.

methods.name: add
methods.description:
Adds a repeated item of the same type.

If  no object is set, a initial FieldNode of the same type is added to the repeats.

elements.name: furo-data-hide-content

attributes.name: hide-on-false
attributes.description: Hide element on false instead of true

attributes.name: animated
attributes.description: Set this to animate the collapse and expand.

properties.name: hideOnFalse
properties.description: Hide element on false instead of true

properties.name: animated
properties.description: Set this to animate the collapse and expand.

methods.name: bind-data
methods.description:
Bind a entity field to the date-input. You can use the entity even when no data was received.
When you use `at-object-ready` from a `furo-data-object` which emits a EntityNode, just bind the field with `--entity(*.fields.fieldname)`

methods.name: hide
methods.description: hides the content

methods.name: show
methods.description: shows the content

methods.name: toggle
methods.description: Toggle the current visibility state.

events.name: value-changed
events.description: Fired when the visibility changed, contains the current visibility state

events.name: hid
events.description: Fired when the content gets hid

events.name: showed
events.description: Fired when the content gets visible

elements.name: furo-data-object

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The name of the type you want to use. The type must be registered in Env

properties.name: type
properties.description: The name of the type you want to use. The type must be registered in Env

properties.name: json
properties.description: get the data from the data object as raw json

methods.name: inject-raw
methods.description:
inject a raw data response from the corresonding agent.

Input may look something like this:

**Entity data**

```json
{
  data : {},
  links : [],
  meta : {}
}
```

**Collection data**

```json
{
  data : {},
  links : [],
  meta : {},
  entities : []
}
```

methods.name: set-pristine
methods.description:
Set all nodes to pristine

Useful for working with deltas

methods.name: clear-all-errors
methods.description: Clears all errors on children without any validation!

methods.name: validate-all-fields
methods.description:
Triggers the validation of all fields in the data object.

Use this before you submit some data to a server.

Will cause a `data-object-became-valid` or `data-object-became-invalid` and a validation-success or validation-failed event.

methods.name: append-errors
reset
methods.description:
Reset the model to the last injected state.

To set the model to the initial state use init

methods.name: init
get-data
methods.description: get the data of the data object

events.name: data-injected
events.description: Fired when injected data was processed (**bubbles**).

events.name: data-changed
events.description: Fired when data in furo-data-object has changed  (**bubbles**). This event fires a lot, consider using a de-bounce with the event.

events.name: data-changed-after-inject
events.description: Fired when data in furo-data-object has changed after injectRaw is complete (**bubbles**). This event fires a lot, consider using a de-bounce with the event.

events.name: field-value-changed
events.description: Fired when a field has changed.

events.name: validation-success
events.description: Fired when validation results in a valid state.

events.name: validation-failed
events.description: Fired when validation results in a invalid state.

events.name: data-object-became-invalid
events.description: Fired when the data object switches from ininvalid to invalid state (**bubbles**).

events.name: data-object-became-valid
events.description: Fired when the data object switches from invalid to valid state (**bubbles**).

events.name: object-ready
events.description: Fired when the object defined by `type` is built (**bubbles**).

events.name: init-completed
events.description: Fired when the object init was done (**bubbles**).

methods.name: qp-in
methods.description:
Furo-deep-link consumes a object literal with key value pairs.

This can come from the `*.query` part of an event from furo-location.

Or from a furo-pages wire.

Relevant wires from furo-pages:
- --pageQueryChanged(*.query)
- --pageActivated(*.query)
- --pageHashChanged(*.query)

methods.name: trigger
methods.description:
Evaluates hts. Use qpIn(qp) if you have a qp object in your event.detail
This method have no effect as long _qp is not set.

methods.name: set-service
methods.description: Sets the service by wire

events.name: hts-out
events.description: Fired when hateoas is available

Your update service must have a query param **update_mask** to use this feature.

https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/standard_methods#update

You may not need it if your server can handle PATCHes without a update_mask
https://grpc-ecosystem.github.io/grpc-gateway/docs/patch.html

elements.name: furo-entity-field
elements.description:
Use this component to interact with fields from a furo-data-object.

You can update the field value or listen to changes of a field.

```html
<furo-entity-field fn-bind-data="--dataObject(*.field)"></furo-entity-field>
```

properties.name: value
properties.description: Set a value to update the fieldnode

methods.name: set-value
methods.description: Set the value of the field.

methods.name: bind-data
methods.description:
Bind a FieldNode to the date-input.

`--personDO(*.person.firstname)`

methods.name: delete-node
methods.description: Trigger deleteNode on the `FieldNode`.

events.name: value-changed
events.description: Fired when the field value or a child value of it was changed.

elements.name: furo-hateoas-state

methods.name: enable
methods.description: Enable or show all nodes.

methods.name: disable
methods.description: Disable or hide all nodes.

methods.name: bind-data
methods.description: Binds a fieldNode. Make sure the type of your field is accepted by the implemented component.

methods.name: bind-hts
methods.description: Bind a `RepeaterNode` of type `furo.Link`.

methods.name: inject-hts
methods.description:
Inject a link array directly.

```json
[
  {
     href :  /mockdata/persons/list ,
     method :  GET ,
     rel :  list ,
     type :  person.PersonCollection ,
     service :  PersonService 
  }
]
```

elements.name: furo-message-container-handler
elements.description:
`furo-message-container-handler`
 will update the 'value states' of all fields of your data object from the injected `furo.MessageContainer` message.

methods.name: inject-raw
methods.description: This will set the corresponding value-states on the sibling nodes of the bounded `furo.MessageContainer` field.

methods.name: bind-message-container
methods.description:
bindMc Bind a `furo.MessageContainer` fieldnode.

The updates from the injected raw messagecontainer are applied to the siblings of the bounded node.

methods.name: bind-root-node
methods.description:
bindMc Bind a `furo.MessageContainer` fieldnode.

The updates from the injected raw messagecontainer are applied to the siblings of the bounded node.

events.name: success
events.description: Fired when success field was set on the received `furo.MessageContainer`.

events.name: no-success
events.description: Fired when the success field on the `furo.MessageContainer` was not set or is set to false.

events.name: has-confirmation
events.description: Fired when the message container contains any confirmation field, with list with all `furo.ConfirmationMessage`.

events.name: has-errors
events.description: Fired when the message container contains any error field, with list with all error fields.

events.name: has-success
events.description: Fired when the message container contains any success field, with list with all success fields.

events.name: has-warnings
events.description: Fired when the message container contains any warning field, with list with all warning fields.

events.name: has-infos
events.description: Fired when the message container contains any info field, with list with all info fields.

elements.name: furo-rel-exists
elements.description:
`furo-rel-exists`
Checks if a hateoas relation exists in a given hateaos Links array.

```html
<furo-rel-exists rel="update" service="person.Personservice" fn-inject="--HTS-array"></furo-rel-exists>
```

attributes.name: rel
attributes.description: Name of the rel

attributes.name: service
attributes.description: define the service if you want a specific check on the service also

properties.name: rel
properties.description: Name of the rel

properties.name: service
properties.description: define the service if you want a specific check on the service also

methods.name: inject
methods.description:
Inject a HTS Link Array to receive a `rel-exist` or a `rel-dont-exist` event.

inject returns true for existing links and false for non existing links.
TODO: implement bind data too
TODO: emit a event with bool which is triggered on any change of the hts array or binded data

events.name: furo-rel-exists
events.description: Fired when rel exists in `linkArray`.

events.name: rel-dont-exist
events.description: Fired when rel does not exists in `linkArray`.

elements.name: furo-reverse-deep-link

attributes.name: service
attributes.description: Name of service

attributes.name: rel
attributes.description:
Optional rel to convert.

Not needed if you inject a link object.

If you insert an entity rel self is taken. If you insert a collection, rel list is used.

properties.name: service
properties.description: Name of service

properties.name: rel
properties.description:
Optional rel to convert.

Not needed if you inject a link object.

If you insert an entity rel self is taken. If you insert a collection, rel list is used.

methods.name: convert
methods.description:
converts the href of a LinkObject

returns Error on undefined service

events.name: converted
events.description: Fired when input was converted.

elements.name: furo-type-renderer
elements.description:
The furo-type-renderer is used to display type specific data. It uses **display** as default context and will warn you
on the console if the requested `context-[type-name]` does not exist or was not imported.

There is a standard set of display components @furo/ui5/src/standard-type-renderers for rendering the individual types.

The standard ui5 set can be integrated with the import
- import '@furo/ui5/src/standard-type-renderers/display-registry.js'.

The standard material set can be integrated with the import
- import '@furo/data-ui/src/standard-type-renderers/display-registry.js'.

If you want to implement an individual display of a type, you need your own `context-[type-name]` component and import it.

for repeated fields you should write your own context-[type-name]-repeated component and import it.
If no context-[type-name]-repeated exists, the renderer will use the display-[type] component as fallback and
display it repeatedly, this is ok for a lot of cases.

## Naming convention

```
display-google-type-timeofday
------- ---------------------
   |             |
context      type-name

# examples:
cell-string
celledit-string
display-string
yourcontext-string

The method to evaluate the renderer is built as following:

context-[(package.type).replaceAll('.', '-').toLocaleLowerCase()]
```



## Basic Usage
```html
  <furo-type-renderer fn-bind-data="--dao(*.data.fieldname)"></furo-type-renderer>
```

## Writing your own renderer
The only API you need to implement in your component is the `bindData()` method.
You just have to follow the naming convention for your renderer.

attributes.name: context
attributes.description:
Set the context if you need another then display.
Prebuilt context renderers exist for display, cell, celledit.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: A Boolean attribute which, if present, means this field is displayed in disabled state.

properties.name: context
properties.description:
Set the context if you need another then display.
Prebuilt context renderers exist for display, cell, celledit.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: A Boolean attribute which, if present, means this field is displayed in disabled state.

methods.name: bind-data
methods.description: Bind a fieldnode of any type

methods.name: focus
methods.description: forward the focus to the created element

elements.description:
## This is a helper class for the agents

Update query params
a qp like {"active":true} will just update the qp *active*

If the current value of the qp is not the same like the injected value, a qp-changed event will be fired

methods.name: set-qp
methods.description:
Set query params
All existing query params are replaced by the transferred parameters
If the transferred object is empty or undefined, all the values will be removed!

methods.name: get-params
methods.description: get existing params from href and append query params

methods.name: rebuild-qp-from-params
methods.description: rebuild qp from params

methods.name: generate-header-accept
methods.description: generate accept field for header

methods.name: generate-req
methods.description: generate request url from original link and qp

events.name: qp-changed
events.description: Fired when query params changed

events.name: qp-set
events.description: Fired when query params are replaced

events.name: xxx-rejected
events.description: Fired when the request for a rel was rejected because the hts was not available TODO: convert to a base class, so the agents can extend this class

elements.description: EntityNode is usually the root node of an eventTree

properties.name: _value
properties.description: This setter aliases to injectRaw. Added for compatibility reasons for the FieldNodeAdapter

methods.name: clear-all-errors
methods.description: clears all errors on every fieldnode

methods.name: set-all-to-pristine
methods.description:
set all children to pristine
useful for deltas

methods.name: inject-raw
methods.description: injects a raw model e.g. body data of a collection or entity

methods.name: reset
methods.description: Resete zum letzten injected state zurck

methods.name: get-json
methods.description: Returns a json representation of your Data Object

methods.name: get-validity-message
methods.description: Returns a json representation of all field validity messages

elements.description:
## internal events
- *this-field-became-invalid*, when a field gets invalid
- *field-became-invalid* **bubbles**, when a field gets invalid
- *this-field-became-valid*, when a field gets valid
- *field-became-valid* **bubbles**, when a field gets valid
- *this-field-value-changed*, when the value of a field changed
- *field-value-changed* **bubbles**, when the value of a field changed
- *this-metas-changed*, when the metas of a field changed
- *metas-changed* **bubbles**, when the meta of a field changed
- *oneof-field-cleared*, when a field in a oneof group was cleared
- *oneof-field-changed*, when a field in a oneof group was changed
- *this-node-field-added*, when a sub field was added to a field
- *node-field-added* **bubbles**, when a sub field was added to a field
- *this-node-field-deleted*, when a sub field was added to a field
- *node-field-deleted* **bubbles**, when a sub field was added to a field
- *any-type-removed*, fired before a node of type any changes its inner type
- *any-type-created*, fired when a node of type any is created or the type was changed


## internal broadcasted events
- *parent-readonly-meta-set*, when readonly was set on a parent field

properties.name: defaultvalue
properties.description: Set the value of the field to the specified defaults.

properties.name: _spec
properties.description: Reference to the current spec definition of the fieldNode

properties.name: _pristine
properties.description: Pristine state of the fieldNode, this is always set to true when new data is injected and is false if the value itself or the value of a child node gets changed.

properties.name: _isValid
properties.description: Validity of the fieldNode, this is always set to true when new data is injected and is false if the value itself validates to false or the value of a child node validates to false.

methods.name: create-field
methods.description:
create a field in a FieldNode, this is useful when using map<string,something>
  set the value option to init with values

methods.name: reinit
methods.description:
sets the field to the initial values from the spec
default values are applied

methods.name: delete-node
methods.description: deletes the fieldnode

elements.description:
Use this class to make your component bindable without handling with the internals of FieldNode.

Read more in the GUIDE section please.

methods.name: bind-data
methods.description: Binds a fieldNode. Make sure the type of your field is accepted by the implemented component.

elements.description:
## internal events
- *before-repeated-field-changed*, fired before new data is injected
- *this-metas-changed*, when the metas of a field changed
- *repeat-became-valid*, fired when all sub items are valid, after one was invalid before
- *repeat-became-invalid*, fired when one sub item switches to a invalid state
- *repeated-fields-changed*, fired when this or any child repeaters was changed (new data, add, remove)
- *this-repeated-field-changed*, fired when this repeater was changed (new data, add, remove)
- *repeated-fields-all-removed* fired when all nodes of a repeater was deleted
- *this-repeated-field-removed*, fired whe a node of this repeater was deleted
- *this-node-field-deleted*, fired when this node was deleted
- *node-field-deleted, fired when a child node was deleted
- *repeated-fields-added*, fired when a node on this or any child repeater was added
- *this-repeated-field-added*, fired when a node on this repeater was added

properties.name: clearListOnNewData
properties.description: Set this to true to clear the list on new data instead updating the current list.

methods.name: reinit
methods.description: resets the field to the initial _values from the spec

methods.name: reset
methods.description: removes all children

methods.name: remove-all-children
methods.description: deletes all repeated fields on this node

methods.name: -has-ancestor-of-type
methods.description:
infinite recursive element protection
we can return false here, because a repeater node is not created automatically

methods.name: delete-child
methods.description: Deletes a repeated item by index

methods.name: is-numeric-type
methods.description: checks if a type is numeric (usefull when you want to compare min or max constraints)

methods.name: is-scalar-type
methods.description: checks if a type is scalar

elements.description: A class to validate constraints on type <code>string</code
A class to validate constraints on numeric types
